str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From gramma. A writer, i.e. scribe or secretary.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Of Hebrew origin; a separatist, i.e. Exclusively religious; a Pharisean, i.e. Jewish sectary.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Strengthened for a primary edo; used only in certain tenses, the rest being supplied by phago; to eat.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
A publican, collector of taxes. From telos and oneomai; a tax-farmer, i.e. Collector of public revenue.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

A publican, collector of taxes. From telos and oneomai; a tax-farmer, i.e. Collector of public revenue.
Sinning, sinful, depraved, detestable. From hamartano; sinful, i.e. A sinner.
